author: Inside Edition
description: Convicted murderer Bryan Kohberger claims he is the target of "minute-by-minute verbal threats/harassment." The complaint came in a hand-written Idaho Department of Correction Resident Concern form. Kohberger also wrote about the lack of food he is being served in prison. In another complaint, Kohberger claims he is the victim of "overt sexually violent threats/statements." Kohberger wants to be moved to a different part of the prison.
title: Bryan Kohberger Requests Move to Different Prison Block

author: Inside Edition
description: When a house caught fire, these neighbors did not wait for the fire trucks to arrive. One dad threw himself against the door. Another man tried kicking the door. Neighbors learned there was a dog in the home and the race to save it was on. Multiple people joined in to try to kick the door down. Glass broke and they were in. It turned out there were two dogs inside the home, cowering in terror in the laundry room.
title: Hero Neighbors Save Dogs Trapped in Blazing Home

author: Inside Edition
description: Cile Steward's father wiped tears as his wife testified Wednesday in support of new state legislation that would bolster safety at summer camps.
title: Parents of Missing Camp Mystic Kids Speak Out #shorts

author: Inside Edition
description: Famed 'Biggest Loser" personality Jillian Michaels acted like a drill sergeant on the hit show. Now, she's speaking out to Inside Edition about the new Netflix documentary, "Fit for TV: The Reality of the Biggest Loser." The show accuses her of giving caffeine pills to contestants to help them lose weight, which Michaels says was no secret. Caffeine supplements make users feel less hungry. They're legal, but the documentary says only the show's medical staff could provide them.
title: Jillian Michaels Speaks Out After New 'Biggest Loser' Documentary

author: Inside Edition
description: Judge Frank Caprio was known as the nicest judge in America. For nearly 40 years, Judge Caprio ran his courtroom in Providence, Rhode Island with a soft touch, cutting folks a break when he thought they deserved it. His good natured antics made him a viral hit on YouTube. His popularity led to his own syndicated show, "Caught in Providence," where he continued to hand out justice with compassion. Judge Caprio passed away from pancreatic cancer.
title: Judge Frank Caprio, Known As 'America's Nicest Judge,' Dies at 88

author: Inside Edition
description: Erik Menendez went before a parole board Thursday to plead for his release. It will be Lyle Menendez's turn on Friday. The hit Netflix series "Monsters: The Lyle and Erik Menendez Story" sparked renewed interest in the notorious case. The brothers killed their parents with shotgun blasts at their Beverly Hills mansion in 1989. In recent months, Menendez family members have stepped up their support for Erik and Lyle's release after the brothers claimed they were sexually abused by their father.
title: Erik Menendez Pleads for His Release After Over 30 Years in Prison

author: Inside Edition
description: Elieah Boyd was going to carry her bike across railroad tracks. She says she noticed an Amtrak train in the distance, but thought she had enough time to make it. She didn't, and her right arm was severed by the train. An off-duty firefighter witnessed the accident and called 911. Elieah was airlifted to a hospital where doctors were able to reattach her arm. Inside Edition was there when Boyd was released. A GoFundMe page to help her recovery can be found here: https://bit.ly/4fJC9QA.
title: Woman's Arm Reattached After It Was Severed by Train

author: Inside Edition
description: One official said Erin was triggering dangerous rip tides "several blocks wide."
title: Hurricane Erin Causes Dangerous Rip Currents #shorts

author: Inside Edition
description: For months in the fall of 1980, a man known as the ".22 Caliber Killer" terrorized Black men in Buffalo, New York, where he killed six people. Then, just days before Christmas, he set his sights on New York City.
title: The '.22 Caliber Killer' and the 'Midtown Slasher' Were the Same Man #shorts

author: Inside Edition
description: Chilling just-released video shows a knife rampage inside a Michigan Walmart.
title: Walmart Knife Attack Caught on Camera #shorts

author: Inside Edition
description: Grammy-winning saxophonist Dave Koz and his band were on a plane trying to get to Seattle for the next shows in their tour. However, he and all the other passengers were frustrated to hear that, after a diversion, their plane was having mechanical issues and would need to be swapped out. A flight attendant asked the band to play something to lift the passengers' spirits. Inside Edition Digital’s Mara Montalbano has more.
title: Dave Koz and Jazz Band Play for Fellow Passengers Stuck on Delayed Flight

author: Inside Edition
description: Police bodycam captured the moment prosecutor Devon Flanagan was handcuffed in a ritzy Newport, Rhode Island nightspot.
title: Watch Top Prosecutor Get Handcuffed at Ritzy Club #shorts
